Title: The Return
Trivia: Andrey Zvyagintsev's first feature as a director (he previously made 2 episodes of Chyornaya komnata (2000)). See more »
Goofs: When Ivan is sitting in the car, the camera pans around the car (before we see him grab the binoculars and begin to use them) - as it pans past the triangular car window you can see the camera reflected in it. See more »
Crazy_Credits: During the end credits, there are still photos. See more »
Cast: Vladimir Garin, Ivan Dobronravov, Konstantin Lavronenko, Nataliya Vdovina, Galina Popova, Aleksey Suknovalov, Lazar Dubovik, Elizaveta Aleksandrova, Lyubov Kazakova, Andrey Sumin, Aleksey Proshchikin, Viktor Alenin, Stas Orlov, Arseniy Belousov, Sofya Bagdasarova
Plot: In the Russian wilderness, two brothers face a range of new, conflicting emotions when their father - a man they know only through a single photograph - resurfaces. Two teenage Russian boys have their father return home suddenly after being absent for 12 years. The father takes the boys on a holiday to a remote island on a lake in the north of Russia that turns into a test of manhood of almost mythic proportions. Written by Sujit R. Varma
Awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 28 wins & 13 nominations.
Actors: Vladimir Garin, Ivan Dobronravov, Konstantin Lavronenko
Writer: Vladimir Moiseenko, Aleksandr Novototskiy-Vlasov (as Aleksandr Novototskiy)
Description: Directed by Andrey Zvyagintsev.  With Vladimir Garin, Ivan Dobronravov, Konstantin Lavronenko, Nataliya Vdovina. In the Russian wilderness, two brothers face a range of new, conflicting emotions when their father - a man they know only through a single photograph - resurfaces.
